<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In this newsletter you’ll find important business news, less important business news, and things that would be inaccurate to classify as business news, like trivia games, tech tips, and book recommendations. We hope we’ll become as much a part of your morning routine as forgetting your packed lunch in the fridge. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/22/un-wants-investigators-look-alleged-saudi-hack-bezoss-phone?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Adventures of Huckleberry Phone
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, and others" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NzMxODc5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pool / Bandar Algaloud/Anadolu Agency/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve got a drama to rival <em>The Godfather</em> today. The first twist? Our protagonist is an iPhone X. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two independent UN human rights experts <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/22/tech/jeff-bezos-mbs-phone-hack/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called</a> for an "immediate investigation" by U.S. authorities into the alleged Saudi hacking of Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos's smartphone. The announcement came after reviewing a newly released report from a cybersecurity firm Bezos hired to look into the breach. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The upshot: </strong></span><span>The firm, FTI Consulting, </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/bezos-phone-was-likely-hacked-by-chat-account-linked-to-saudi-prince-audit-finds-11579666857?mod=business_lead_pos7&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">believes</a></span><span> "with medium to high confidence" that a WhatsApp account linked to Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MBS) hacked into Bezos’s phone in May 2018. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FWIW, the Saudi embassy has called the allegations “absurd.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The prequel: </strong>Last March, Bezos’s security chief, Gavin de Becker, <a href="https://www.thedailybeast.com/jeff-bezos-investigation-finds-the-saudis-obtained-his-private-information?ref=topic&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">publicly accused</a> the Saudi government of targeting Bezos in an effort to quash the mogul’s Washington Post and its reporting on the murder of MBS critic Jamal Khashoggi. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The timeline, per FTI</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Act I, April 2018, Los Angeles: </strong>Bezos and MBS have dinner and exchange phone numbers. MBS sends Bezos a message on WhatsApp. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Act II, May 2018: </strong>Bezos’s phone <a href="https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/v74v34/saudi-arabia-hacked-jeff-bezos-phone-technical-report?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">receives a message</a> from the MBS account that includes a video file and an encrypted downloader. Soon after, the phone starts spitting out 29,000% more data than usual. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Act III, November 2018</strong>: The phone <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/21/technology/bezos-phone-hacking.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gets another message</a> from the MBS account that contained a photo of a woman who looked like Lauren Sanchez, Bezos's girlfriend. Their affair hadn't been made public yet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Act IV, February 2019: </strong>The phone receives a message reading in part, “there is nothing against you or Amazon from me or Saudi Arabia”—just days after Bezos had phone conversations about the Saudis waging an online war against him. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The takeaways</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For one, the episode is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-22/bezos-hack-claim-clouds-start-of-big-year-for-saudi-crown-prince?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dumping salt</a> in wounds over the 2018 killing of Khashoggi, an issue MBS had hoped to leave behind as he sets out to accomplish an ambitious 2020 agenda. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For another, it's becoming clear that Bezos’s ownership of the Washington Post is getting him ensnared in some of the world's thorniest geopolitical disputes. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/22/us-department-transportation-cracking-support-animals-planes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dept. of Transportation Gets Petty
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Rock’s latest movie may be all the emotional support you’re allowed on your next flight. Yesterday, the U.S. Department of Transportation <a href="https://apnews.com/c78235bd8a3408e39de28847c482ff84?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">debuted a proposal</a> to crack down on the use of emotional support animals. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The new rules would only allow </span><span><span>specially </span></span><span>trained dogs on flights. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Airlines, flight attendants, advocates for people with disabilities, and others have been <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/4741bade-3d28-11ea-b232-000f4477fbca?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">complaining</a> about passengers bending emotional support animal rules. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2018, Delta Air Lines said it flew about 250,000 support animals per year, more than double the 2015 number. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some flyers have shown up with pigs, turkeys, and yes, even...</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/jU2TN9y1nzrid3Nz64/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em>Giphy</em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Industry reps have had it with these unsupportive snakes on this highly profitable plane. They say people game the system by claiming they need their pets for emotional support, ducking pet fees that typically run north of $100 each way. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus, untrained animals endanger airline staff and interfere with trained animals, say veteran and disability groups. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the public will have 60 days to comment on the potential changes.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/22/tesla-tops-100-billion-market-value-short-squeeze-ensues?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bad Day to Be a Tesla Hater
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A Tesla car going past the finish line " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NzMwNjczLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The electric car company became the first publicly listed U.S. automaker to cross <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-22/tesla-hits-100-billion-mark-musk-must-sustain-for-big-payout?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$100 billion in market value</a>, eclipsing the combined values of other homegrown heroes Ford and GM.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How Tesla doubled its share price in three months:</strong> 1) It <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-stocks/tesla-races-past-100-billion-in-market-valuation-idUSKBN1ZL24Z?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> a surprise Q3 profit 2) it topped annual delivery expectations and 3) its Shanghai factory is churning out Model 3s at a breakneck clip.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That’s good for...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">CEO Elon Musk.</strong> If he can keep Tesla’s market cap <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/elon-musk-net-worth-tesla-100-billion-valuation-340-million-payout-possible/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">above $100 billion</a> for the foreseeable future, he’ll get a roughly $346 million payout.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That’s not good for...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tesla short sellers</strong>, or investors betting against the company.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>The vocal <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2020-01-22/the-tesla-tslaq-skeptics-who-bet-against-elon-musk?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">#TSLAQ short community</a> lost more than $2.8 billion in 2019, per S3 Partners. They’ve already lost about that much in 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That’s a short squeeze. </strong>When a stock does what Tesla’s is doing (rocketing toward $600/share), short sellers are <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/22/tesla-stock-rally-is-squeezing-short-sellers-and-helping-elon-musk.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">forced</a> to give up their bearish bets and buy back shares to cut losses...which in turn pushes prices even higher.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GROCERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/22/fairway-reportedly-preparing-changes-denies-bankruptcy-plans?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fairway Keeps Bankruptcy Hawks, NYers on Our Toes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photo of the exterior of a Fairway location with crowds coming in the doors." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTQwL2FfcGhvdG9fb2ZfdGhlX2V4dGVyaW9yX29mX2FfZmFpcndheV9sb2NhdGlvbl93aXRoX2Nyb3dkc19jb21pbmdfaW5fdGhlX2Rvb3JzLkpQRyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Meverbeaver, FairwayMarket ParamusOpening, CC BY 3.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Tuesday, the NY Post <a href="https://nypost.com/2020/01/21/fairway-planning-to-file-for-chapter-7-bankruptcy-will-close-all-stores/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> that NYC grocery institution Fairway Market was filing for Chapter 7 bankruptcy and closing its 14 stores. New Yorkers <a href="https://www.eater.com/2020/1/22/21076876/fairway-rumored-closure-nyc-grocery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reacted</a> like someone told them to eat funfetti cream cheese on a toasted rainbow bagel.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Then yesterday, Fairway dismissed the NY Post’s report</strong>, saying the claim was “categorically untrue and disappointing.” But that doesn’t mean all is well.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Fairway said it’s soon announcing a transaction “that will provide for the </span><span><a href="https://gothamist.com/food/fairway-denies-report-it-will-close-all-nyc-stores?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ongoing operations</a></span><span>” of its stores. Mysterious.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The NYT </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/nyregion/fairway-market-bankruptcy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a></span><span> Fairway </span><span><em>had</em></span><span> considered bankruptcy, but plans about its future remain unclear.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chapter anything would be familiar territory for Fairway, which declared Chapter 11 in 2016 and stayed alive thanks to a financing deal from private equity giant Blackstone.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Fairway’s saga illustrates how difficult it is for regional grocery chains to compete in the era of Amazon-owned Whole Foods, countless delivery apps, and the cult of Trader Joe’s. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/22/planters-sets-new-standard-brand-twitter-mr-peanuts-death?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Great Moments in Brand Twitter History
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A GIF of Mr. Peanut falling to his death in a canyon from the brand's video social campaign." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ZECO89jmnSL9ul0OLh/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A GIF of Mr. Peanut falling to his death in a canyon from the brand's video social campaign." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ZECO89jmnSL9ul0OLh/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brand Twitter is the term used to describe the (often cringey) <a href="https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/pangw8/brand-twitter-is-absurd-and-it-will-only-get-worse?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">marketing ploys</a> from companies trying to go viral on the platform. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest submission: </strong>Yesterday, Planters announced on Twitter the death of Mr. Peanut at the overly ripe age of 104. The <a href="https://nypost.com/2020/01/22/planters-announces-mr-peanut-dead-at-104-after-heroic-act/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">actual news</a>, we think, is that the spokesnut will no longer represent the brand. Stay tuned for a Super Bowl ad that will give us the much-needed backstory.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whether Mr. Peanut's demise moved you to tears, or, more likely, moved you to eat peanuts, it’s a good time to remember past triumphs and missteps of Brand Twitter:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">December 2017: </strong></span><span>Netflix was criticized when it creepily and judgmentally </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/netflix/status/940051734650503168?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E940051734650503168&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fmashable.com%2F2017%2F12%2F11%2Fnetflix-a-christmas-prince-tweet-privacy%2F&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a></span><span>, “To the 53 people who’ve watched A Christmas Prince every day for the past 18 days: Who hurt you?” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Summer 2019: </strong></span><span>Who could forget the </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/21/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-reveals-important-business-trends?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">great chicken sandwich wars</a></span><span> between Popeyes, Wendy’s, and Chick-fil-A?</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">December 2019: </strong></span><span><span>When a guy named Gary tweeted, “Who let New Jersey have a Twitter,” the </span></span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/NJGov?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">official State of New Jersey account</a></span><span><span> replied “your mom.”</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>

<tr>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A powerful fashion magazine editor has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/meryl-streeps-tribeca-penthouse-sells-for-15-8-million-11579633208?mod=hp_lead_pos12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold</a> her Tribeca penthouse, the WSJ reports. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The actress’s condo has suffered multiple price cuts since it first went on the market in August 2018...but probably not because of its amenities:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">

</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So, here’s the question:</strong> How much did the condo sell for? Keep scrolling for the answer.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Adventures of Huckleberry Phone\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, and others\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5NzMxODc5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePool / Bandar Algaloud/Anadolu Agency/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’ve got a drama to rival \u003cem\u003eThe Godfather\u003c/em\u003e today. The first twist? Our protagonist is an iPhone X. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo independent UN human rights experts \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/22/tech/jeff-bezos-mbs-phone-hack/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled\u003c/a\u003e for an \"immediate investigation\" by U.S. authorities into the alleged Saudi hacking of Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos's smartphone. The announcement came after reviewing a newly released report from a cybersecurity firm Bezos hired to look into the breach. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe upshot: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe firm, FTI Consulting, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/bezos-phone-was-likely-hacked-by-chat-account-linked-to-saudi-prince-audit-finds-11579666857?mod=business_lead_pos7\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebelieves\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \"with medium to high confidence\" that a WhatsApp account linked to Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MBS) hacked into Bezos’s phone in May 2018. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFWIW, the Saudi embassy has called the allegations “absurd.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe prequel: \u003c/strong\u003eLast March, Bezos’s security chief, Gavin de Becker, \u003ca href=\"https://www.thedailybeast.com/jeff-bezos-investigation-finds-the-saudis-obtained-his-private-information?ref=topic\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epublicly accused\u003c/a\u003e the Saudi government of targeting Bezos in an effort to quash the mogul’s Washington Post and its reporting on the murder of MBS critic Jamal Khashoggi. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe timeline, per FTI\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAct I, April 2018, Los Angeles: \u003c/strong\u003eBezos and MBS have dinner and exchange phone numbers. MBS sends Bezos a message on WhatsApp. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAct II, May 2018: \u003c/strong\u003eBezos’s phone \u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/v74v34/saudi-arabia-hacked-jeff-bezos-phone-technical-report?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereceives a message\u003c/a\u003e from the MBS account that includes a video file and an encrypted downloader. Soon after, the phone starts spitting out 29,000% more data than usual. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAct III, November 2018\u003c/strong\u003e: The phone \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/21/technology/bezos-phone-hacking.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egets another message\u003c/a\u003e from the MBS account that contained a photo of a woman who looked like Lauren Sanchez, Bezos's girlfriend. Their affair hadn't been made public yet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAct IV, February 2019: \u003c/strong\u003eThe phone receives a message reading in part, “there is nothing against you or Amazon from me or Saudi Arabia”—just days after Bezos had phone conversations about the Saudis waging an online war against him. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe takeaways\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor one, the episode is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-22/bezos-hack-claim-clouds-start-of-big-year-for-saudi-crown-prince?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edumping salt\u003c/a\u003e in wounds over the 2018 killing of Khashoggi, an issue MBS had hoped to leave behind as he sets out to accomplish an ambitious 2020 agenda. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor another, it's becoming clear that Bezos’s ownership of the Washington Post is getting him ensnared in some of the world's thorniest geopolitical disputes. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edebuted a proposal\u003c/a\u003e to crack down on the use of emotional support animals. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe new rules would only allow \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003especially \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003etrained dogs on flights. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAirlines, flight attendants, advocates for people with disabilities, and others have been \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/4741bade-3d28-11ea-b232-000f4477fbca?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecomplaining\u003c/a\u003e about passengers bending emotional support animal rules. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2018, Delta Air Lines said it flew about 250,000 support animals per year, more than double the 2015 number. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome flyers have shown up with pigs, turkeys, and yes, even...\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/jU2TN9y1nzrid3Nz64/giphy.gif\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIndustry reps have had it with these unsupportive snakes on this highly profitable plane. They say people game the system by claiming they need their pets for emotional support, ducking pet fees that typically run north of $100 each way. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlus, untrained animals endanger airline staff and interfere with trained animals, say veteran and disability groups. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong href=\"https://nypost.com/2020/01/21/fairway-planning-to-file-for-chapter-7-bankruptcy-will-close-all-stores/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e that NYC grocery institution Fairway Market was filing for Chapter 7 bankruptcy and closing its 14 stores. New Yorkers \u003ca href=\"https://www.eater.com/2020/1/22/21076876/fairway-rumored-closure-nyc-grocery?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereacted\u003c/a\u003e like someone told them to eat funfetti cream cheese on a toasted rainbow bagel.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThen yesterday, Fairway dismissed the NY Post’s report\u003c/strong\u003e, saying the claim was “categorically untrue and disappointing.” But that doesn’t mean all is well.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFairway said it’s soon announcing a transaction “that will provide for the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://gothamist.com/food/fairway-denies-report-it-will-close-all-nyc-stores?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eongoing operations\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” of its stores. Mysterious.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe NYT \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/nyregion/fairway-market-bankruptcy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Fairway \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ehad\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e considered bankruptcy, but plans about its future remain unclear.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChapter anything would be familiar territory for Fairway, which declared Chapter 11 in 2016 and stayed alive thanks to a financing deal from private equity giant Blackstone.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Fairway’s saga illustrates how difficult it is for regional style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe latest submission: \u003c/strong\u003eYesterday, Planters announced on Twitter the death of Mr. Peanut at the overly ripe age of 104. Stay tuned for a Super Bowl ad that will give us the much-needed backstory.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhether Mr. Peanut's demise moved you to tears, or, more likely, moved you to eat peanuts, it’s a good time to remember past triumphs and missteps of Brand Twitter:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDecember 2017: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNetflix was criticized when it creepily and judgmentally \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/netflix/status/940051734650503168?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E940051734650503168\u0026ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fmashable.com%2F2017%2F12%2F11%2Fnetflix-a-christmas-prince-tweet-privacy%2F\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, “To the 53 style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSummer 2019: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWho could forget the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/21/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-reveals-important-business-trends?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egreat chicken sandwich wars\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e between Popeyes, Wendy’s, and Chick-fil-A?\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong
